QuestionText: Which of the following best describes the primary goal of differentiated instruction in a classroom?
OptionA: To assign different homework to every student based on their interests.
OptionB: To provide varied approaches to content, process, and product to meet individual student needs.
OptionC: To group students strictly by academic ability for all lessons.
OptionD: To ensure all students complete the same tasks at the same pace.

QuestionText: A teacher regularly uses exit tickets, thumbs-up/down checks, and short quizzes during a lesson to gauge student understanding and adjust instruction. This is an example of what type of assessment?
According to constructivist learning theory, students primarily learn best when they:
OptionA: Are passively lectured by the teacher.
OptionC: Actively construct their own understanding through experience and reflection.
OptionD: Work independently on assigned tasks without peer interaction.

QuestionText: Which of the following is the most effective proactive strategy for classroom management?
OptionA: Implementing strict penalties after misbehavior occurs.
OptionB: Clearly establishing and teaching classroom rules and routines at the beginning of the year.
OptionC: Sending students out of the classroom for every minor infraction.
OptionD: Ignoring minor disruptive behaviors to avoid escalation.

QuestionText: Universal Design for Learning (UDL) primarily aims to:
OptionA: Create individual education plans (IEPs) for students with disabilities.
OptionB: Design instruction and materials to be accessible to the widest range of learners from the outset.
OptionC: Provide additional support only to struggling students after they fall behind.
OptionD: Standardize all teaching methods to ensure consistency across classrooms.

QuestionText: A teacher asks students to use their knowledge of fractions to bake a cake using a scaled recipe. This task primarily targets which level of Bloom's Taxonomy (revised)?
What is the main purpose of a Professional Learning Community (PLC) among teachers?
OptionA: To discuss school politics and administrative decisions.
OptionB: To collaboratively work towards improving student learning and teaching practices.
OptionC: To plan social events for the school staff.
OptionD: To primarily share personal anecdotes about difficult students.

QuestionText: Which characteristic is NOT typically part of a well-formulated, "SMART" learning objective?
Which of the following is a core competency typically addressed in Socio-Emotional Learning (SEL) programs?
In an inquiry-based learning environment, the teacher's primary role is typically to:
OptionA: Provide all answers and direct students step-by-step through tasks.
OptionB: Facilitate student questioning, exploration, and discovery.
OptionC: Strictly adhere to a pre-set curriculum without deviation.
